title: The Weight-Monodromy Conjecture and LPO: Constructive Calibration of Spectral Sequence Degeneration via De-Omniscientizing Descent (Paper 45, Constructive Reverse Mathematics Series)
description:
Paper 45 of the Constructive Reverse Mathematics series. We apply CRM to calibrate the logical strength of spectral sequence degeneration in the context of the Weight-Monodromy Conjecture (WMC) for smooth projective varieties over p-adic fields. We establish four theorems (C1–C4) that together constitute a constructive calibration of the Arithmetic Kashiwara Conjecture—the single remaining obstruction to the full WMC.

C1 (Polarization ⇒ Degeneration in BISH): Hodge polarization forces degeneration via equational reasoning from positive-definiteness; no omniscience required. Full proof, no custom axioms.

C2 (DecidesDegeneration(K) ↔ LPO(K)): Abstract spectral sequence degeneration decidability is exactly LPO for the coefficient field. Full proof, no custom axioms.

C3 (Archimedean Positivity Obstruction): Over any p-adic field, no positive-definite Hermitian form exists in dimension ≥ 3, permanently blocking the polarization strategy.

C4 (De-Omniscientizing Descent): For geometric perverse sheaves, degeneration is decidable in BISH. Geometric origin descends the coefficient field from undecidable Qℓ to decidable Q̄, replacing LPO with finite decidable equality.

The Lean 4 / Mathlib formalization comprises 9 source files (~1,247 lines), compiles with zero errors, zero warnings, and zero sorry. Theorems C1 and C2 are full proofs; C3 and C4 derive consequences from explicitly documented axioms. Sub-lemma 5 (Arithmetic Kashiwara Conjecture) is a hypothesis parameter, not an axiom, preserving conditionality.
